name: Valentine's Day Strawberry Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: This is one of my favorite cookie recipes, and the strawberry flavor and pink color make them a great surprise for Valentine's Day!
recipeIngredient: 1 ¼ cups semisweet chocolate chips, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix together cake mix and baking powder in a large bowl and set aside.

Whisk together eggs, oil, and vanilla extract in a smaller bowl. Add egg mixture to cake mixture and stir vigorously to form a dough; be sure to incorporate all pockets of dry cake mix. Gently mix in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded balls of dough, about 2 1/2 tablespoons each, onto the prepared baking sheet; make balls taller than they are wide. Add 1 or 2 additional chocolate chips onto each cookie, if desired.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes; do not let cookies brown.

Allow the soft cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 3 minutes. Cookies will sink as they cool; you can press down gently with your fingers if necessary. Transfer cookies to a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Valentine's Day Strawberry Chocolate Chip Cookies

review.reviewBody: I used extra-large eggs and soybean oil, and those were the only changes.  The cookies turned out LARGE and beautiful.  Lots of strawberry flavor.  They have a soft texture.  I would make them again; but, they will not be part of my regular rotation.  I think the 2 1/2 tablespoon size is too large.  I got a dozen big cookies, but could have gotten 2 dozen if I had made them smaller.  They were really sweet.  That could mean I should use a different brand of cake mix.

The first time I tried this recipe, I loved it - the bright pink color, and the wonderful aroma of strawberries is very appealing! The second time though, I had trouble with them - because it's cake (and not cookie) batter, it burns easily. I made 3 batches, and it was hard for me to know when to take them out. With my oven, 10 minutes wasn't enough (they were still mushy after cooling), and 13 meant browning one the bottom. I would also recommend experimenting with different cake mixes. So come out flatter or fluffier than others. I also wasn't sure how long/with what to mix the batter with. All-in-all, a good option to try out for a Valentine's day, but good luck on getting the texture right.
